00056 DmetCHPWriter * DmetCHPWriter::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00057 {
00058         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == DmetCHPWriter::EngineName())
00059                 return (DmetCHPWriter *)engine;
00060         return NULL;
00061 }

00065 DmetCHPWriter::DmetCHPWriter() {
00066   defineOptions();
00067   defineStates();
00068   m_CallCoder = NULL;
00069 }
00070 
00071 void DmetCHPWriter::setHeader(CHPMultiDataData  *data, ParameterNameValueTypeList &params, ParameterNameValueTypeList &metrics){
00072 
00073   ParameterNameValueType param;
00074 
00075   // Prepare headers for all CHP files.
00076   data->SetAlgName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_AlgName));
00077   data->SetAlgVersion(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_AlgVersion));
00078   data->SetArrayType(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_ChipType));
00079 
00080   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("program-name"));
00081   param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_ProgramName));
00082   data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00083   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("program-version"));
00084   param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_ProgramVersion));
00085   data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00086   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("program-company"));
00087   param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_ProgramCompany));
00088   data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00089 
00090   // Encoding parameters
00091   ///@todo we should check these against what was used for the APG output
00092   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("call-encoding-version"));
00093   param.SetValueAscii(getOpt("call-coder-version"));
00094   data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00095   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("call-encoding-max-alleles"));
00096   param.SetValueInt32(getOptInt("call-coder-max-alleles"));
00097   data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00098   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("call-encoding-data-size"));
00099   param.SetValueAscii(getOpt("call-coder-type"));
00100   data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00101 
00102   // Transformation
00103   ///@todo do not hard code
00104   param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("apt-state-transform"));
00105   param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("MvA"));
00106   params.push_back(param);
00107 
00108   // Other parameters from m_Info
00109   for(int i=0; i<m_Info.m_ParamNames.size(); i++) 
00110   {
00111       if (m_Info.m_ParamValues[i].length() > 0)
00112       {
00113           param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_ParamNames[i]));
00114           param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(m_Info.m_ParamValues[i]));
00115           params.push_back(param);
00116       }
00117   }
00118 
00119   data->AddAlgParams(params);
00120   data->AddSummaryParams(metrics);
00121 
00122   ///@todo propigate meta info from a5 input files for each sub-engine
00123 }  
00124 
00125 void DmetCHPWriter::setCopyNumberData(
00126         CHPMultiDataFileWriter &writer, 
00127         vector<string> copyNumberRegionNames,
00128         string celFileName ){
00129 
00130   map<string,DmetCopyNumberData> cnData;
00131 
00132   string copyNumberFileName = getOpt("a5-copynumber");
00133   bool haveCnData = true;
00134   if(copyNumberFileName == "") {
00135       haveCnData = false;
00136   }
00137 
00138   if(haveCnData) {
00139 
00140     affx::File5_File copyNumberFile5;
00141     affx::File5_Tsv* copyNumberTsv5 = NULL;
00142 
00143     try {
00144 
00145         copyNumberFile5.open(copyNumberFileName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00146         string copyNumberPrefix = getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".copynumber";
00147         copyNumberTsv5= copyNumberFile5.openTsv(copyNumberPrefix);
00148         if(copyNumberTsv5==NULL)
00149             APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get copy number data from a5 file while writing CHP file.");
00150 
00151         string justReadCelFileName;
00152 
00153         while(copyNumberTsv5->nextLevel(0)==affx::FILE5_OK){
00154             DmetCopyNumberData data;
00155             int dataInt;
00156             double dataDouble;
00157     
00158             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "cel", &justReadCelFileName)!=affx::FILE5_OK)
00159                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cel' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00160 
00161             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "region", &data.name)!=affx::FILE5_OK)
00162                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cel' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00163 
00164             dataInt = m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NotAvailable");   
00165             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "cn_call", &dataInt) != FILE5_OK)
00166                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cn_call' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00167             data.call = dataInt;
00168 
00169             dataDouble = -2.0;
00170             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "pvalue", &dataDouble) != FILE5_OK)
00171                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'pvalue' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00172             data.confidence = dataDouble;
00173 
00174             dataInt = m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NotAvailable");   
00175             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "cn_force", &dataInt) != FILE5_OK)
00176                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cn_force' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00177             data.force = dataInt;
00178 
00179             dataDouble = -2.0;
00180             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "cn_estimate", &dataDouble) != FILE5_OK)
00181                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cn_estimate' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00182             data.estimate=dataDouble;
00183 
00184             dataInt = -2;
00185             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "cn_lower", &dataInt) != FILE5_OK)
00186                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cn_lower' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00187             data.lower = dataInt;
00188 
00189             dataInt = -2;
00190             if(copyNumberTsv5->get(0, "cn_upper", &dataInt) != FILE5_OK)
00191                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to get column 'cn_upper' from CN file '"+copyNumberFileName+"'.");
00192             data.upper = dataInt;
00193 
00194             if(justReadCelFileName == celFileName){
00195                 if(cnData.find(data.name) != cnData.end())
00196                     APT_ERR_ABORT("Duplicate entries found for CN region '"+data.name+"' in sample '"+celFileName+"'");
00197                 cnData[data.name] = data;
00198             }
00199         }
00200 
00201         copyNumberTsv5->close();
00202         Freez(copyNumberTsv5);
00203         copyNumberFile5.close(); 
00204     }
00205     catch(...)
00206     {
00207         Freez(copyNumberTsv5);
00208         throw;
00209     }
00210   }
00211 
00212   string regionName;
00213   vector<string>::const_iterator beginIter=copyNumberRegionNames.begin();
00214   vector<string>::const_iterator endIter=copyNumberRegionNames.end();
00215   writer.SeekToDataSet(DmetCopyNumberMultiDataType);
00216   for(; beginIter!=endIter; beginIter++){
00217     regionName = *beginIter;
00218 
00219     if(cnData.find(regionName) != cnData.end()) { // We have valid data and write to CHP file.
00220       writer.WriteEntry(cnData[regionName]);
00221     } else {  // We write dummy data  as the probeset has been hidden.
00222       DmetCopyNumberData entry;
00223       entry.name =regionName ;
00224       entry.call = DMET_INVALID_INTEGER;
00225       entry.confidence = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00226       entry.force = DMET_INVALID_INTEGER;
00227       entry.estimate = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00228       entry.lower = DMET_INVALID_INTEGER;
00229       entry.upper = DMET_INVALID_INTEGER;
00230 
00231       writer.WriteEntry(entry);
00232     }// end of else of copyNumberRegionIsInCNFile check     
00233 
00234   }// end of the loop over the complete list of probesets.
00235 }
00236 
00237 void parseContext(const string &context, string &aAllele, string &bAllele, string &aContext, string &bContext) {
00238   bContext = context;
00239   bAllele = bContext.substr(0,bContext.rfind(","));
00240   aContext = bAllele.substr(0,bAllele.rfind(","));
00241   aAllele = aContext.substr(0,aContext.rfind(","));
00242   bContext = bContext.substr(bContext.rfind(",")+1);
00243   bAllele = bAllele.substr(bAllele.rfind(",")+1);
00244   aContext = aContext.substr(aContext.rfind(",")+1);
00245 }
00246 
00247 void computeMaxSignal(const string &psName, const int maxAlleles, const int maxContext, map<string, double> &summaries, vector<double> &maxSignals, vector<int> &maxContexts) {
00248     maxSignals.resize(maxAlleles);
00249     maxContexts.resize(maxAlleles);
00250     for(int aId = 0; aId < maxAlleles; aId++) {
00251         int context = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00252         double signal = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00253         for(int cId = 0; cId <= maxContext; cId++) {
00254             string name = psName + "-" + ToStr(aId) + "-" + ToStr(cId);
00255             if(summaries.find(name) != summaries.end()) {
00256                 double newSignal = summaries[name];
00257                 if(newSignal > signal) {
00258                     signal = newSignal;
00259                     context = cId;
00260                 }
00261             }
00262         }
00263         maxContexts[aId] = context;
00264         maxSignals[aId] = signal;
00265     }
00266 }
00267 
00268 void DmetCHPWriter::setGenotypeData(
00269         CHPMultiDataFileWriter &writer, 
00270         vector<string> const &probesetNames,
00271         vector<int> const &probesetAlleles,
00272         map<string,int> &alleleMap,
00273         string celFileName,
00274         ChipLayout &layout,
00275         map<string, int> &calls,
00276         map<string, int> &forcedCalls,
00277         map<string, double> &confidences,
00278         map<string, double> &summaries,
00279         map<string, string> &contexts
00280         ){
00281 
00282   // Write out bi-alleleic markers on first pass
00283   writer.SeekToDataSet(DmetBiAllelicMultiDataType);
00284   for(int pIx = 0; pIx < probesetNames.size(); pIx++) {
00285       string psName = probesetNames[pIx];
00286       int allele = probesetAlleles[alleleMap[psName]];
00287       if(allele==2){
00288         if(calls.find(psName) == calls.end()) {
00289             DmetBiAllelicData entry;
00290             entry.name = psName;
00291             entry.call = m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NotAvailable");   
00292             entry.confidence = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00293             entry.force = entry.call;
00294             entry.signalA = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00295             entry.signalB = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00296             entry.contextA = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00297             entry.contextB = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00298             writer.WriteEntry(entry);
00299         } else {
00300             DmetBiAllelicData entry;
00301             entry.name = psName;
00302             entry.call = calls[psName];
00303             entry.force = forcedCalls[psName];
00304             entry.confidence = confidences[psName];
00305     
00306             // Parse out allele and context
00307             string context = contexts[psName];
00308             string aAllele, bAllele, aContext, bContext;
00309             parseContext(context, aAllele, bAllele, aContext, bContext);
00310 
00311             // Set allele signal and context
00312             entry.signalA = summaries[psName + "-" + aAllele + "-" + aContext];
00313             entry.signalB = summaries[psName + "-" + bAllele + "-" + bContext];
00314             if(getOptBool("null-context")) {
00315                 entry.contextA = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00316                 entry.contextB = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00317             } else {
00318                 entry.contextA = Convert::toInt(aContext);
00319                 entry.contextB = Convert::toInt(bContext);
00320             }
00321             writer.WriteEntry(entry);
00322         }
00323       }
00324   }
00325   // Write out multi-alleleic markers on second pass
00326   writer.SeekToDataSet(DmetMultiAllelicMultiDataType);
00327   for(int pIx = 0; pIx < probesetNames.size(); pIx++) {
00328       string psName = probesetNames[pIx];
00329       int allele = probesetAlleles[alleleMap[psName]];
00330       if(allele>2){
00331         if(calls.find(psName) == calls.end()) {
00332             DmetMultiAllelicData entry;
00333             entry.name = psName;
00334             entry.call = m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NotAvailable");   
00335             entry.confidence = DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE;
00336             entry.force = entry.call;
00337             entry.alleleCount = allele;
00338             ///@todo cannot assume no gaps in allele designation
00339             entry.signalA = (allele >= 1 ? DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE : 0.0);
00340             entry.signalB = (allele >= 2 ? DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE : 0.0);
00341             entry.signalC = (allele >= 3 ? DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE : 0.0);
00342             entry.signalD = (allele >= 4 ? DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE : 0.0);
00343             entry.signalE = (allele >= 5 ? DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE : 0.0);
00344             entry.signalF = (allele >= 6 ? DMET_INVALID_DOUBLE : 0.0);
00345             entry.contextA = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00346             entry.contextB = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00347             entry.contextC = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00348             entry.contextD = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00349             entry.contextE = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00350             entry.contextF = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00351             writer.WriteEntry(entry);
00352         } else {
00353             DmetMultiAllelicData entry;
00354             entry.name = psName;
00355             entry.call = calls[psName];
00356             entry.force = forcedCalls[psName];
00357             entry.confidence = confidences[psName];
00358             entry.alleleCount = allele;
00359     
00360             // Parse out allele and context
00361             string context = contexts[psName];
00362             string aAllele, bAllele, aContext, bContext;
00363             parseContext(context, aAllele, bAllele, aContext, bContext);
00364     
00365             // Set allele signal and context
00366             entry.signalA = summaries[psName + "-" + aAllele + "-" + aContext];
00367             entry.signalB = summaries[psName + "-" + bAllele + "-" + bContext];
00368             if(getOptBool("null-context")) {
00369                 entry.contextA = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00370                 entry.contextB = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00371             } else {
00372                 entry.contextA = Convert::toInt(aContext);
00373                 entry.contextB = Convert::toInt(bContext);
00374             }
00375 
00376             vector<double> maxSignals;
00377             vector<int>    maxContexts;
00378 
00379             // There could be gaps in allele and context IDs
00380             ProbeListPacked pList = layout.getProbeListByName(psName);
00381             if (pList.isNull()) {
00382               APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to find probeset '"+psName+"' in layout");
00383             }
00384 
00385             int maxContext = 0;
00386             for(int bIx=0; bIx < pList.block_cnt(); bIx++)
00387                 if(pList.get_blockContext(bIx) > maxContext)
00388                     maxContext = pList.get_blockContext(bIx);
00389             computeMaxSignal(psName, 6, maxContext, summaries, maxSignals, maxContexts);
00390     
00391             // set max signal for each allele over all context
00392             ///@todo cannot assume no gaps in allele designation
00393             entry.signalA = (allele >= 1 ? maxSignals[0] : 0.0);
00394             entry.signalB = (allele >= 2 ? maxSignals[1] : 0.0);
00395             entry.signalC = (allele >= 3 ? maxSignals[2] : 0.0);
00396             entry.signalD = (allele >= 4 ? maxSignals[3] : 0.0);
00397             entry.signalE = (allele >= 5 ? maxSignals[4] : 0.0);
00398             entry.signalF = (allele >= 6 ? maxSignals[5] : 0.0);
00399             // set context with max signal for each allele
00400             ///@todo cannot assume no gaps in allele designation
00401             if(getOptBool("null-context")) {
00402                 entry.contextA = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00403                 entry.contextB = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00404                 entry.contextC = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00405                 entry.contextD = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00406                 entry.contextE = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00407                 entry.contextF = DMET_INVALID_UINT;
00408             } else {
00409                 entry.contextA = (allele >= 1 ? maxContexts[0] : DMET_INVALID_UINT);
00410                 entry.contextB = (allele >= 2 ? maxContexts[1] : DMET_INVALID_UINT);
00411                 entry.contextC = (allele >= 3 ? maxContexts[2] : DMET_INVALID_UINT);
00412                 entry.contextD = (allele >= 4 ? maxContexts[3] : DMET_INVALID_UINT);
00413                 entry.contextE = (allele >= 5 ? maxContexts[4] : DMET_INVALID_UINT);
00414                 entry.contextF = (allele >= 6 ? maxContexts[5] : DMET_INVALID_UINT);
00415             }
00416             writer.WriteEntry(entry);
00417         }
00418       } 
00419   }// end of the loop over the complete list of probesets.
00420 }
00421 
00422 void DmetCHPWriter::fillInReportMetrics(const string &reportFile, const string &celFile, ParameterNameValueTypeList &metrics) {
00423     // a bit of a waste in that we keep re-reading this file for each cel file
00424     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00425 
00426     /* Some values one might see:
00427         cel_files
00428         computed_gender
00429         call_rate
00430         het_rate
00431         hom_rate
00432         cluster_distance_mean
00433         cluster_distance_stdev
00434         raw_intensity_mean
00435         raw_intensity_stdev
00436         allele_summarization_mean
00437         allele_summarization_stdev
00438         allele_deviation_mean
00439         allele_deviation_stdev
00440         allele_mad_residuals_mean
00441         allele_mad_residuals_stdev
00442         cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanX
00443         cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanY
00444         cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_ratio
00445         cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender
00446     */
00447 
00448     //WARNING: We do not automatically load everything. One reason would be that if
00449     //         some one consented everything but one marker, one could probably use
00450     //         certain fields to infer the genotype of the missing marker
00451 
00452     string foundCelFile;
00453     double callRate = 0.0;
00454     string computedGender = "unknown";
00455     double cnMeanX = 0.0, cnMeanY = 0.0, cnRatio = 0.0;
00456     string cnGender = "unknown";
00457 
00458     tsv.bind(0,"cel_files",      &foundCelFile,         affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00459     tsv.bind(0,"total_call_rate",      &callRate,        affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00460     tsv.bind(0,"computed_gender",&computedGender,  affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00461 
00462     tsv.bind(0,"cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanX",&cnMeanX,   affx::TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00463     tsv.bind(0,"cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanY",&cnMeanY,   affx::TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00464     tsv.bind(0,"cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_ratio",&cnRatio,   affx::TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00465     tsv.bind(0,"cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender",      &cnGender,  affx::TSV_BIND_OPTIONAL);
00466 
00467     if(tsv.open(reportFile) != affx::TSV_OK)
00468         APT_ERR_ABORT("Couldn't open file: '" + reportFile + "' to read.");
00469     bool found = false;
00470     while((tsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) && !found) {
00471         if(foundCelFile == celFile) {
00472 
00473             ParameterNameValueType param;
00474 
00475             param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("qc_call_rate"));
00476             callRate = roundDouble(callRate, 2);
00477             param.SetValueFloat(callRate);
00478             metrics.push_back(param);
00479 
00480             param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("computed_gender"));
00481             param.SetValueAscii(computedGender);
00482             metrics.push_back(param);
00483 
00484             if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanX") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00485                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanX"));
00486                 param.SetValueFloat(cnMeanX);
00487                 metrics.push_back(param);
00488             }
00489 
00490             if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanY") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00491                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_meanY"));
00492                 param.SetValueFloat(cnMeanY);
00493                 metrics.push_back(param);
00494             }
00495 
00496             if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_ratio") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00497                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender_ratio"));
00498                 param.SetValueFloat(cnRatio);
00499                 metrics.push_back(param);
00500             }
00501 
00502             if(tsv.cname2cidx(0, "cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00503                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("cn-probe-chrXY-ratio_gender"));
00504                 param.SetValueAscii(cnGender);
00505                 metrics.push_back(param);
00506             }
00507 
00508             found = true;
00509         }
00510     }
00511 
00512     tsv.close();
00513 }
00514 
00515 void DmetCHPWriter::parseRegionsFile(vector<string> &copyNumberRegionNames, int &regionCount) {
00516   // We first read the complete list of CN regions from the region-model.txt file.
00517   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00518   string regionFileName = getOpt("region-model");
00519   if (tsv.open(regionFileName) != TSV_OK)
00520     APT_ERR_ABORT("Couldn't open " + regionFileName + " to read while writing CHP files.");
00521 
00522   string regionName;
00523   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK){
00524     if ((tsv.get(0,"region",regionName)!=TSV_OK) || (regionName=="")) {
00525       APT_ERR_ABORT("No region name or empty region name was found while reading the region-model file while writing CHP files.");
00526     }
00527     copyNumberRegionNames.push_back(regionName);
00528     regionCount++;
00529   }
00530 } 
00531 
00532 void DmetCHPWriter::loadLayout(ChipLayout &layout, std::vector<string> &probesetNames, std::vector<int> &alleles) {
00533 
00534   string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
00535   string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
00536 
00537   std::vector<bool> probeSubset;
00538   probeidmap_t killList;
00539   std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> probeSetsToLoad;
00540   std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> psTypesToLoad;
00541   psTypesToLoad.insert(affxcdf::MarkerProbeSetType);
00542   vector<const char *> psNames;
00543 
00544   try {
00545     if(cdfFile != "") {
00546       Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening layout file: ") + cdfFile);
00547       if(!layout.openCdf(cdfFile, probeSetsToLoad, &psNames,
00548                          probeSubset, "", killList, false, psTypesToLoad)) {
00549         APT_ERR_ABORT("Couldn't open layout file: " + cdfFile);
00550       }
00551     }
00552     else if(spfFile != "") {
00553       Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening layout file: ") + spfFile);
00554       layout.openSpf(spfFile, probeSetsToLoad, &psNames, probeSubset,
00555                            "", false, psTypesToLoad);
00556     }
00557     else {
00558       APT_ERR_ABORT("Must have either a cdf file or spf file.");
00559     }
00560   }
00561   catch(const Except &e) {
00562     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < psNames.size(); i++) {
00563       Freez(psNames[i]);
00564     }
00565     psNames.clear();
00566     APT_ERR_ABORT(e.what());
00567   }
00568   catch(...) {
00569     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < psNames.size(); i++) {
00570       Freez(psNames[i]);
00571     }
00572     psNames.clear();
00573     APT_ERR_ABORT("Unknown exception caught - terminating.");
00574   }
00575   Verbose::out(2, "Loaded " + ToStr(psNames.size()) + " probesets.");
00576 
00577   for(int i=0; i<psNames.size(); i++){
00578       probesetNames.push_back(string(psNames[i]));
00579   }
00580 
00581   for(uint32_t i = 0; i < psNames.size(); i++) {
00582       Freez(psNames[i]);
00583   }
00584   psNames.clear();
00585 
00586   // Figure out how many alleles for each probeset
00587   for(int pIx=0; pIx < layout.getProbeSetCount(); pIx++) {
00588     ProbeListPacked pList = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(pIx);
00589     map<int,int> alleleMap;
00590     for(int bIx=0; bIx < pList.block_cnt(); bIx++) {
00591         alleleMap[pList.get_blockAllele(bIx)] = 1;
00592     }
00593     alleles.push_back(alleleMap.size());
00594   }
00595 }
00596 
00597 void DmetCHPWriter::fillInCallMetrics(map<string,int> &calls, ParameterNameValueTypeList &metrics) {
00598     map<string,int>::iterator iter = calls.begin();
00599     int count=0, het=0, hom=0, pra=0, nc=0, zcn=0;
00600     for(;iter != calls.end(); iter++) {
00601         count++;
00602         if(m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("PossibleRareAllele") == iter->second){
00603             pra++;
00604         } else if(m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("ZeroCopyNumber") == iter->second){
00605             zcn++;
00606         } else if(m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NoCall") == iter->second){
00607             nc++;
00608         } else if(m_CallCoder->isHom(iter->second)){
00609             hom++;
00610         } else if(m_CallCoder->isHet(iter->second)){
00611             het++;
00612         } else {
00613             Verbose::out(1,"Unaccounted for call (" + ToStr(iter->second) + "). Treating as no-call for summary stats.");
00614             nc++;
00615         }
00616     }
00617 
00618     double callRate = (count - nc) / double(count) * 100;
00619     double homRate = (hom) / double(count) * 100;
00620     double hetRate = (het) / double(count) * 100;
00621     //double praRate = (pra) / double(count) * 100;
00622 
00623     callRate = roundDouble(callRate, 2);
00624     homRate = roundDouble(homRate, 2);
00625     hetRate = roundDouble(hetRate, 2);
00626 
00627     // Add Call Rate
00628     ParameterNameValueType param;
00629 
00630     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("call_rate"));
00631     param.SetValueFloat(callRate);
00632     metrics.push_back(param);
00633     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("het_rate"));
00634     param.SetValueFloat(hetRate);
00635     metrics.push_back(param);
00636     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("hom_rate"));
00637     param.SetValueFloat(homRate);
00638     metrics.push_back(param);
00639     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("call_count"));
00640     param.SetValueInt32(count - nc);
00641     metrics.push_back(param);
00642     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("hom_count"));
00643     param.SetValueInt32(hom);
00644     metrics.push_back(param);
00645     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("het_count"));
00646     param.SetValueInt32(het);
00647     metrics.push_back(param);
00648     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("pra_count"));
00649     param.SetValueInt32(pra);
00650     metrics.push_back(param);
00651     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("cn0_count"));
00652     param.SetValueInt32(zcn);
00653     metrics.push_back(param);
00654     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("no_call_count"));
00655     param.SetValueInt32(nc);
00656     metrics.push_back(param);
00657     param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS("probeset_count"));
00658     param.SetValueInt32(count);
00659     metrics.push_back(param);
00660 
00661     Verbose::out(3,"Call Metrics: " +
00662             ToStr(count) + " markers, " +
00663             ToStr(het) + " het, " +
00664             ToStr(hom) + " hom, " +
00665             ToStr(pra) + " pra, " +
00666             ToStr(zcn) + " cn0, " +
00667             ToStr(nc) + " nc");
00668 }
00669 
00670 void DmetCHPWriter::runImp(){
00671  
00672   vector<string> celFiles = getOptVector("cels");
00673   setOpt("cels",celFiles);
00674 
00675   // Load up chip layout info
00676   int biAlleleCount=0;
00677   int multiAlleleCount=0;
00678   ChipLayout layout;
00679   vector<string> probesetNames; /// The names of the probesets (lib file order)
00680   map<string,int> alleleMap; 
00681   vector<int> probesetAlleles; /// The number of alleles in the probesets (lib file order)
00682   CHPMultiDataData *data = NULL;
00683 
00684   try {
00685 
00686     m_CallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(getOptInt("call-coder-max-alleles"),getOpt("call-coder-type"),getOpt("call-coder-version"), '\0');  
00687 
00688     loadLayout(layout, probesetNames, probesetAlleles);
00689     for(int i=0; i<probesetAlleles.size(); i++) {
00690         if(probesetAlleles[i] > 2)
00691             multiAlleleCount++;
00692         else if(probesetAlleles[i] == 2)
00693             biAlleleCount++;
00694     }
00695     
00696     // Figure out max probeset name length
00697     int maxProbeSetNameLength = 0;
00698     for(int i=0; i<probesetNames.size(); i++) {
00699         if(probesetNames[i].size() > maxProbeSetNameLength)
00700             maxProbeSetNameLength = probesetNames[i].size();
00701         alleleMap[probesetNames[i]] = i;
00702     }
00703 
00704     sort(probesetNames.begin(),probesetNames.end());
00705     
00706     //  These are the copy number regions as defined in the regions file. 
00707     //  Again, when loaded into the vector they maintain the order as seen in the regions file.
00708     int regionCount=0;
00709     vector<string> copyNumberRegionNames;
00710     parseRegionsFile(copyNumberRegionNames, regionCount);
00711     
00712     // Figure out max region name
00713     int maxRegionNameLength = 0;
00714     for(int i=0; i<copyNumberRegionNames.size(); i++)
00715         if(copyNumberRegionNames[i].length() > maxRegionNameLength)
00716             maxRegionNameLength = copyNumberRegionNames[i].size();
00717 
00718    sort(copyNumberRegionNames.begin(),copyNumberRegionNames.end()); 
00719     
00720     // We will first read the summary file to get a list of the CEL files we are dealing with.
00721     vector<string> celFileNames = getOptVector("cels");
00722     
00723     // Setup output folder
00724     if(!Fs::isWriteableDir(getOpt("out-dir")))
00725       if(Fs::mkdirPath(getOpt("out-dir"), false) != APT_OK) {
00726         APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + getOpt("out-dir"));
00727       }
00728     
00729     // Iterate over each sample and generate a CHP file
00730     vector<string>::iterator begin = celFileNames.begin();
00731     vector<string>::iterator end = celFileNames.end();
00732     Verbose::out(1,"Generating CHP files with " + ToStr(biAlleleCount) + " bi-allele, " + ToStr(multiAlleleCount) + " multi-allele, and " + ToStr(regionCount) + " region entries.");
00733     Verbose::progressBegin(1, ToStr("Generating CHP files"), celFileNames.size(), 1, celFileNames.size());
00734     for(; begin!=end; begin++){
00735         Verbose::progressStep(1);
00736         string celFileName = Fs::basename(*begin);
00737         string celFilePrefix = Fs::noextname1(celFileName);
00738         string outFileName = Fs::join(getOpt("out-dir"), celFilePrefix + "." + getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".chp.tmp");
00739     
00740         { // put CHP writer/data in nested scope so that they are destroyed
00741           // and the file closed before we try and rename.
00742 
00743             data = new CHPMultiDataData(outFileName);
00744 
00745             // set parent header
00746             FusionCELData cel;
00747             try {
00748                 cel.SetFileName(begin->c_str());
00749                 if(!cel.ReadHeader()) {
00750                     APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to read CEL file " + celFileName);
00751                 }
00752                 GenericData *gdata = cel.GetGenericData();
00753                 if (gdata != NULL)
00754                 {
00755                     data->GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr()->AddParent(*gdata->Header().GetGenericDataHdr());
00756                 }
00757                 cel.Close();
00758             }
00759             catch (...)
00760             {
00761                 APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to read CEL file " + celFileName);
00762             }
00763      
00764             // Initialize the size of the 3 CHP sections and the max length of the probeset
00765             // name.  These are Calvin format required values. 
00766             data->SetEntryCount(DmetBiAllelicMultiDataType, biAlleleCount, maxProbeSetNameLength);
00767             data->SetEntryCount(DmetMultiAllelicMultiDataType, multiAlleleCount, maxProbeSetNameLength);
00768             data->SetEntryCount(DmetCopyNumberMultiDataType, regionCount, maxRegionNameLength);
00769     
00770             // Load up data
00771             // perhaps we should really keep the File5/Tsv5 objects around rather than open/close for each sample
00772             // perhaps we should really only load up the probeset names once, not for each sample
00773             map<string, int> calls;
00774             fillVectorFromA5<int>(getOpt("a5-calls"), getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".calls", celFileName, calls);
00775             map<string, int> forcedCalls;
00776             fillVectorFromA5<int>(getOpt("a5-forced-calls"), getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".forced-calls", celFileName, forcedCalls);
00777             map<string, double> confidences;
00778             fillVectorFromA5<double>(getOpt("a5-confidences"), getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".confidences", celFileName, confidences);
00779             map<string, double> summaries;
00780             fillVectorFromA5<double>(getOpt("a5-summaries"), getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".summary", celFileName, summaries);
00781             map<string, string> contexts;
00782             fillVectorFromA5<string>(getOpt("a5-context"), getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".context", celFileName, contexts);
00783     
00784             ParameterNameValueTypeList params;
00785             ParameterNameValueTypeList metrics;
00786 
00787             // Filter Calls
00788             map<string, int>::iterator iter = calls.begin();
00789             float cutoff = getOptDouble("geno-call-thresh");
00790             for(;iter != calls.end(); iter++) {
00791                 if(m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("PossibleRareAllele") != iter->second && 
00792                        m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("ZeroCopyNumber")  != iter->second) {
00793                     if(confidences[iter->first] > cutoff) {
00794                         ///@todo should we handle cn aware no calls? eg N NN NNN ...
00795                         iter->second = m_CallCoder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NoCall");
00796                     } else {
00797                         iter->second = forcedCalls[iter->first];
00798                     }
00799                 }
00800             }
00801     
00802             // Write Header
00803             fillInCallMetrics(calls,metrics);
00804             fillInReportMetrics(getOpt("report-file"),celFileName,metrics);
00805     
00806             setHeader(data, params, metrics);
00807      
00808             CHPMultiDataFileWriter writer(*data);
00809     
00810             // Populate Data
00811             setGenotypeData(writer, probesetNames, probesetAlleles, alleleMap, celFileName, layout, calls, forcedCalls, confidences, summaries, contexts); 
00812             setCopyNumberData(writer, copyNumberRegionNames, celFileName);
00813   
00814             // close chp file
00815             Freez(data);
00816 
00817         }
00818         std::string from = outFileName;
00819         std::string to = outFileName.substr(0,outFileName.rfind(".tmp"));
00820         if (!Fs::fileRename(from,to,false)) {
00821             APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to rename '" + from + "' to '" + to +"' ("+strerror(errno)+")");
00822         }
00823     } // end for loop over cel files
00824     Freez(m_CallCoder);
00825   } // end try
00826   catch(...)
00827   {
00828         Freez(data);
00829         Freez(m_CallCoder);
00830         throw;
00831   }
00832   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00833 }
00834 
00835 void DmetCHPWriter::defineOptions() {
00836 
00837   defineOptionSection("Input Options");
00838     defineOption("", "a5-copynumber", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00839                      "CopyNumber Engine output in a5 format. ",
00840                      "");
00841     defineOption("", "a5-summaries", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00842                      "Probeset summary values in a5 format. ",
00843                      "");
00844     defineOption("", "a5-calls", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00845                      "Probeset call values in a5 format. ",
00846                      "");
00847     defineOption("", "a5-forced-calls", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00848                      "Probeset call values in a5 format. ",
00849                      "");
00850     defineOption("", "a5-confidences", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00851                      "Probeset confidence values in a5 format. ",
00852                      "");
00853     defineOption("", "a5-context", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00854                      "Probeset context values in a5 format. ",
00855                      "");
00856     defineOption("", "region-model", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00857                      "Regions model parameters. ",
00858                      "");
00859     defineOption("c", "cdf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00860                      "File defining probe sets. Use either --cdf-file or --spf-file. ",
00861                      "");
00862     defineOption("", "spf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00863                      "File defining probe sets in spf (simple probe format) which is like a text cdf file.",
00864                      "");
00865     defineOption("", "report-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00866                      "Report file from ProbesetGenotype engine.",
00867                      "");
00868 
00869 
00870   defineOptionSection("Analysis Options");
00871     defineOption("", "set-analysis-name", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00872                      "Explicitly set the analysis name. "
00873                      "This affects output file names (ie prefix) and various meta info.",
00874                      "dmet");
00875     defineOption("", "geno-call-thresh", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00876                   "The confidence threshold for reporting calls in the CHP file.",
00877                   "0.1");
00878     defineOption("", "null-context", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00879                     "Indicates whether or not context info should be populated in the CHP files.",
00880                     "true");
00881 
00882   defineOptionSection("Advanced Options");
00883     defineOption("", "call-coder-max-alleles", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00884                     "For encoding/decoding calls, the max number of alleles per marker to allow.",
00885                     "6");
00886     defineOption("", "call-coder-type", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00887                     "The data size used to encode the call.",
00888                     "UCHAR");
00889     defineOption("", "call-coder-version", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00890                     "The version of the encoder/decoder to use",
00891                     "1.0");
00892 
00893   defineOptionSection("Engine Options (Not used on command line)");
00894     defOptMult("", "cels", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00895                      "Cel files to process.",
00896                      "");
00897     defineOption("", "batch-name", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00898                                          "The name of the batch for the dynamic cluster analysis. ",
00899                                          "");
00900 }

00904 void DmetCHPWriter::checkOptionsImp() {

00906     defineStates();
00907 
00908     setLibFileOpt("region-model");
00909     setLibFileOpt("cdf-file");
00910     setLibFileOpt("spf-file");
00911 }
